Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Malondialdehyde level in BCNU - exposed group was higher than those in control groups and melatonin decreased malondialdehyde levels in BCNU group ( P < 0 . 01 ) , while there were no significant differences in the superoxide dismutase levels between these groups .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| BCNU exposure |

In this paragraph, the only disease entity mentioned is "BCNU exposure". The paragraph is discussing the effects of BCNU (an anticancer drug) on malondialdehyde and superoxide dismutase levels. Therefore, BCNU exposure is the valid disease entity in this context.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| BCNU exposure |

In the paragraph, the only entity that clearly refers to a disease or health condition is "BCNU exposure". The other entities mentioned, such as "malondialdehyde level" and "superoxide dismutase levels", are not diseases but rather biomarkers or indicators of the effects of BCNU exposure on the body.
